metadata.Title: CVE-2014-4174 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
wiretap/libpcap.c in the libpcap file parser in Wireshark 1.10.x before 1.10.4 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (memory corruption and application crash) via a crafted packet-trace file that includes a large packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-4174` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 1.10.7-4
libwireshark11 - 1.10.7-4
libwiretap8 - 1.10.7-4
libwscodecs2 - 1.10.7-4
libwsutil9 - 1.10.7-4
tshark - 1.10.7-4
wireshark - 1.10.7-4
wireshark-common - 1.10.7-4
wireshark-gtk - 1.10.7-4
wireshark-qt - 1.10.7-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.10.7-4').
